title: Winnipeg Blue Bombers GAMEDAY
text:
Kickoff : 6:30 p.m.; TD Place 
TV : TSN; Radio: CJOB; Twitter: @PentonKirk 
The line: Ottawa -4 
Winnipeg Blue Bombers The Bombers are coming off a 29-26 victory over the B.C. Lions, during which they outscored the Leos 20-3 in the second half. Winnipeg will be making one roster change. C Dominic Picard is out after suffering an unknown injury last week against B.C. Matthias Goossen will start in his place, and Tommy Griffiths will come on the roster to serve as the sixth offensive lineman. The Bombers had a season few 43 penalty yards in last week's win over the Lions. Field goal kicker Sergio Castillo was 5-for-5 in his pro debut last week, and he was the first Bomber to kick a game-winner as time expired since Troy Westwood did it against Saskatchewan on July 10, 2003. Winnipeg's last three games have been decided by three points or fewer. 
Ottawa RedBlacks The RedBlacks are coming off a 38-35 loss to the Toronto Argonauts on Oct. 6 at TD Place. This will be the fourth straight home game for Ottawa, even though it was technically the road team last week against Toronto. The RedBlacks will make five roster changes. In are P Ronnie Pfeffer, S Jeff Richards, LB Nick Rosamonda, WR Reggie Dunn and LB Jordan Verdone. Out are RB Jeremiah Johnson, DE Ettore Lattanzio, DE Marlon Smith, DT Justin Phillips and P Brett Maher (released). Ottawa pummelled Winnipeg 42-20 in their meeting last year at TD Place. It was one of only two RedBlacks victories in their inaugural campaign. Quarterback Henry Burris is attempting to become the oldest quarterback in league history to lead the league in passing yards. He would be 40 years and six months if he can do it, breaking Anthony Calvillo's record of 39 years and three months. 
THE BIG MATCHUP 
RedBlacks front four vs. Bombers offensive line 
Ottawa has a league leading 45 sacks, and Winnipeg will be without veteran centre Dominic Picard, who is out with an unknown injury. Matthias Goossen will make his second career start and will have to make the correct calls at the line of scrimmage to ensure Matt Nichols survives the contest. 
BY THE NUMBERS 
68-10 — Ottawa's points for and against in the third quarter of its last seven games 
381 — Passing yards needed for Henry Burris to reach 60,000 in his career Winnipeg
